member.name: T:System.IO.Pipes.AnonymousPipeServerStreamAcl
member.summary: Provides security related APIs for the class.

member.name: M:System.IO.Pipes.AnonymousPipeServerStreamAcl.Create(System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection,System.IO.HandleInheritability,System.Int32,System.IO.Pipes.PipeSecurity)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified pipe direction, inheritability mode, buffer size, and pipe security.
member.param: One of the enumeration values that determines the direction of the pipe. Anonymous pipes are unidirectional, so direction cannot be set to .
One of the enumeration values that determines whether the underlying handle can be inherited by child processes.
The size of the buffer. This value must be greater than or equal to 0.
An object that determines the access control and audit security for the pipe.
member.exception:
is not set to a valid enum value.
-or-
is less than 0.
member.returns: A new anonymous pipe server stream instance.

member.name: T:System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeServerStreamAcl
member.summary: Provides security related APIs for the class.

member.name: M:System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeServerStreamAcl.Create(System.String,System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection,System.Int32,System.IO.Pipes.PipeTransmissionMode,System.IO.Pipes.PipeOptions,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IO.Pipes.PipeSecurity,System.IO.HandleInheritability,System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified pipe name, pipe direction, maximum number of server instances, transmission mode, pipe options, recommended in and out buffer sizes, pipe security, inheritability mode, and pipe access rights.
member.param: The name of the pipe.
One of the enumeration values that determines the direction of the pipe.
The maximum number of server instances that share the same name. You can pass for this value.
One of the enumeration values that determines the transmission mode of the pipe.
One of the enumeration values that determines how to open or create the pipe.
The input buffer size.
The output buffer size.
An object that determines the access control and audit security for the pipe.
One of the enumeration values that determines whether the underlying handle can be inherited by child processes.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the access rights of the pipe.
member.exception:
contains an invalid flag.
-or-
or is less than zero.
-or-
is not a valid number: it should be greater than or equal to 1 and less than or equal to 254, or should be set to the value of .
-or-
contains an invalid enum value.
-or-
is 'anonymous', which is reserved.
member.returns: A new named pipe server stream instance.

member.name: T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights
member.summary: Defines the access rights to use when you create access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.AccessSystemSecurity
member.summary: Specifies the right to make changes to the system access control list (SACL).

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.ChangePermissions
member.summary: Specifies the right to change the security and audit rules that are associated with a pipe.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.CreateNewInstance
member.summary: Specifies the right to create a new pipe. Setting this right also sets the right.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.Delete
member.summary: Specifies the right to delete a pipe.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.FullControl
member.summary: Specifies the right to exert full control over a pipe, and to modify access control and audit rules. This value represents the combination of all rights in this enumeration.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.Read
member.summary: Specifies the right to read from the pipe. This right includes the , , , and rights.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.ReadAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to read file system attributes from a pipe. This does not include the right to read data, extended file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.ReadData
member.summary: Specifies the right to read data from the pipe. This does not include the right to read file system attributes, extended file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.ReadExtendedAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to read extended file system attributes from a pipe. This does not include the right to read data, file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.ReadPermissions
member.summary: Specifies the right to read access and audit rules from the pipe. This does not include the right to read data, file system attributes, or extended file system attributes.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.ReadWrite
member.summary: Specifies the right to read and write from the pipe. This right includes the , , , , , , and rights.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.Synchronize
member.summary: Specifies whether the application can wait for a pipe handle to synchronize with the completion of an I/O operation. This value is automatically set when allowing access to the pipe and automatically excluded when denying access to the pipe. The right to create a pipe requires this value. Note that if you do not explicitly set this value when you create a pipe, the value will be set automatically for you.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.TakeOwnership
member.summary: Specifies the right to change the owner of a pipe. Note that owners of a pipe have full access to that resource.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.Write
member.summary: Specifies the right to write to the pipe. This right includes the , , and rights.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.WriteAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to write file system attributes to a pipe. This does not include the right to write data or extended file system attributes.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.WriteData
member.summary: Specifies the right to write data to a pipe. This does not include the right to write file system attributes or extended file system attributes.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights.WriteExtendedAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to write extended file system attributes to a pipe. This does not include the right to write file attributes or data.

member.name: T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRule
member.summary: Represents an abstraction of an access control entry (ACE) that defines an access rule for a pipe.

member.name: M:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRule.#ctor(System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference,System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights,System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified identity, pipe access rights, and access control type.
member.param: An object that encapsulates a reference to a user account.
One of the values that specifies the type of operation associated with the access rule.
One of the values that specifies whether to allow or deny the operation.

member.name: M:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRule.#ctor(System.String,System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights,System.Security.AccessControl.AccessControlType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified identity, pipe access rights, and access control type.
member.param: The name of the user account.
One of the values that specifies the type of operation associated with the access rule.
One of the values that specifies whether to allow or deny the operation.

member.name: P:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRule.PipeAccessRights
member.summary: Gets the flags that are associated with the current object.
member.returns: A bitwise combination of the values.

member.name: T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAuditRule
member.summary: Represents an abstraction of an access control entry (ACE) that defines an audit rule for a pipe.

member.name: M:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAuditRule.#ctor(System.Security.Principal.IdentityReference,System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights,System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for a user account specified in a object.
member.param: An object that encapsulates a reference to a user account.
One of the values that specifies the type of operation associated with the access rule.
One of the values that specifies when to perform auditing.

member.name: M:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAuditRule.#ctor(System.String,System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRights,System.Security.AccessControl.AuditFlags)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for a named user account.
member.param: The name of the user account.
One of the values that specifies the type of operation associated with the access rule.
One of the values that specifies when to perform auditing.

member.name: P:System.IO.Pipes.PipeAuditRule.PipeAccessRights
member.summary: Gets the flags that are associated with the current object.
member.returns: A bitwise combination of the values.

member.name: T:System.IO.Pipes.PipesAclExtensions
member.summary: Provides Windows-specific static extension methods for manipulating Access Control List (ACL) security attributes for pipe streams.

member.name: M:System.IO.Pipes.PipesAclExtensions.GetAccessControl(System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream)
member.summary: Returns the security information of a pipe stream.
member.param: The existing pipe stream from which to obtain the security information.
member.returns: The security descriptors of all the access control sections of the pipe stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.Pipes.PipesAclExtensions.SetAccessControl(System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream,System.IO.Pipes.PipeSecurity)
member.summary: Changes the security attributes of an existing pipe stream.
member.param: An existing pipe stream.
The security information to apply to the pipe stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.Pipes.PipeSecurity.RemoveAuditRuleAll(System.IO.Pipes.PipeAuditRule)

member.name: M:System.IO.Pipes.PipeSecurity.ResetAccessRule(System.IO.Pipes.PipeAccessRule)
member.summary: Removes all access rules in the Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) that is associated with the current object and then adds the specified access rule.
member.param: The access rule to add.
